text:
Hello All.

In response to Stephanies transport email I replied with this:

“Maybe the bike group here at Uncorked can help people to get on their bikes, make them feel more comfortable...
This could come in the form of a theory as well as a practical lesson.
Maybe a little group ride or pairing up with someone who wants to get used to it
(I’ve heard several people would like to bike but are intimidated by traffic)

Portland’s bicycle alliance also offer to come into your office to give a theory class (a voluntary little donation is welcomed but not necessary)
I copied some avid cyclists to this email to spread the word.

Thank you for offering an incentive for bike and public transport”

Receiving $240 towards your bike usage is amazing. That certainly pays some  bills or even a second hand bicycle :slightly_smiling_face:

Happy to discuss how we can assist others to bike. Real spring and summer has to come one day, making it easier to transition.
Confirmed with Stephanie it's applicable towards accessories and equipment
What about gear to make riding in the rain less miserable
Discovery benefits should have a list I believe <@U027PV4AP>
Could it be used for Biketown membership/rentals as well?
<@U027PV4AP> is this the plan we are considering? <https://www.discoverybenefits.com/products/commuter-benefits>

attachments.title: Commuter Benefits | Discovery Benefits
attachments.text: A commuter benefits plan allows employees to save on monthly mass transit, parking, bicycling and vanpooling costs, including uberPOOL. Learn more.

text: discovery benefits eligible expenses portal says no for Bicycle Accessories (helmet, clothing, shoes, etc.) though is says yes for “Bicycle Improvements”. I wonder if that will include things like cargo racks and panniers that improve bike commute experience, but could be considered accessories. :confused:
or things like helmets and lights that are mandatory for safe riding?
